174.article_body: Zerodha Co-Founder Nikhil Kamath spoke against Elon Musk offering verification badges on Twitter for $8 monthly subscription saying, "When you make exclusivity publicly accessible, it's no longer exclusivity." Tagging Musk, he added, "Elon Musk, don't make not having a verified badge the new cool (for Twitter's sake)." The subscription has been rolled out in US, Canada, Australia and New Zealand.

175.title: Insurtech platform Plum lays off 36 employees
175.article_body: Sequoia and Tiger Global-backed insurtech platform Plum has laid off 36 employees owing to tough market conditions in the startup ecosystem, Co-Founders Abhishek Poddar and Saurabh Arora said. The laid off staff will be given support such as severance pay, healthcare benefits, well-being counselling and Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), they added. Plum raised $15.6 million in May 2021.

176.title: 5 undertrials booked following clashes at Yerawada Central Prison in Pune
176.article_body: Five undertrials lodged at Pune's Yerawada Central Prison were booked on the charges of unlawful assembly, assault and rioting after clashes broke out inside the prison on Tuesday. The clashes led to stone pelting among inmates and assault on prison employees. The incident occurred in barrack numbers 27 and 31 and near the prison infirmary, Yerawada police station officials said.

177.title: Kejriwal's govt collected ₹1,286 cr as green cess, utilised nothing: BJP's Lekhi
177.article_body: Union Minister Meenakashi Lekhi criticised the Arvind Kejriwal-led AAP government in Delhi alleging that his government has collected ₹1,286 crore from people as Environment Cess and it has not been utilised for improving the condition. She further accused AAP government of showing sheer negligence and said, "Delhi needs a full-time CM. This part-time CM has shown no concern for Delhi."

178.title: Man robs, rapes Noida woman after meeting her on 'Jeevansathi.com'; held
178.article_body: Noida Police on Tuesday said that they had arrested a Ghaziabad man for cheating a woman of ₹30 lakh and raping her after befriending her on 'Jeevansathi.com'. The accused posed as a senior officer at Airtel and took ₹30 lakh from the woman, saying that his sister was suffering from cancer, said Additional DCP (Noida) Ashutosh Dwivedi.

179.title: BMC to close SV Road bridge in Malad, sends notices to vacate shops
179.article_body: After declaring SV Road bridge in Malad dilapidated in 2019, BMC has now sent notices to the shopowners sitting on the alignment of the bridge to vacate their shops. The corporation had completed tendering for its reconstruction but the construction could not be started as the shopowners refused to shift, an official said. They are reportedly unhappy with the compensation.

180.title: Eureka Forbes announces new chief product and technology officer, CFO
180.article_body: Eureka Forbes (EFL) said it has appointed Shubham Srivastava as the Chief Product and Technology Officer and Gaurav Khandelwal as the Chief Financial Officer (CFO). The company said Srivastava will drive digital transformation, while Khandelwal will lead the finance, commercial, legal and secretarial functions. Khandelwal has earlier worked with companies like Hindustan Unilever, Airtel and Oyo.

181.title: Measles outbreak confirmed in Mumbai slum after 3 kids die
181.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has confirmed the outbreak of measles in Govandi's Rafi Nagar slum, which lies in the M/East ward in Mumbai. This comes after three children aged between one and five died in the area after developing rashes and fever. A BMC official said six cases of the contagious disease have been confirmed in Rafi Nagar.

182.title: N Korea fired ballistic missile towards eastern sea: S Korea
182.article_body: North Korea fired a short-range ballistic missile towards its eastern sea from Sukchon, Seoul’s Joint Chiefs of Staff said. Last week, North Korea launched missiles in response to joint drills conducted by South Korea and the US. South Korea’s military said it recovered debris of one of the North Korean missiles determined to be a Soviet-era anti-aircraft weapon.

183.title: Pune girl declared brain-dead after accident, family donates her organs
183.article_body: The parents of a 10-year-old girl donated her organs and saved three persons' lives when she was declared brain-dead after a road accident in Pune. Her heart was donated to a one-year-old girl in Mumbai, while her kidney and liver were donated to a 37-year-old woman and seven-year-old girl, respectively. The girl was hit by a speeding moped in October.

184.title: I was very scared when I posted it: Samantha on revealing about myositis diagnosis
184.article_body: Samantha Ruth Prabhu recently posted a picture showing IV drips attached to her as she dubbed for 'Yashoda' and revealed she was diagnosed with an autoimmune condition, myositis. She said, "I was very scared when I posted it. I was already weak and vulnerable, and I didn't know if I'd enough strength to take if somebody said a wrong thing."

185.title: Man weighing 153 kg granted bail, court says 'obesity is root cause of other diseases'
185.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court has granted bail to a money laundering accused, noting that he's an 'obese' person who weighs 153 kg. Considering his co-morbidities, it can be said that he falls in the exception of being "sick", the court noted. It took note of doctors' opinion and said obesity is the "root cause of several other diseases".

186.title: China factory prices drop for 1st time in 2 years amid COVID-19 curbs
186.article_body: China's factory gate prices or producer price index (PPI) fell by 1.3% year-on-year for October, its first decline since December 2020, the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) data showed on Wednesday. This was driven by faltering domestic demand amid COVID-19 curbs, a property slump and global recession risk hitting the economy. Consumer inflation moderated from a 29-month high in September.

187.title: 16-yr-old B'luru student dies by suicide after being caught cheating
187.article_body: A 16-year-old boy in Bengaluru died after he allegedly jumped from the 14th floor of an apartment building on Tuesday, hours after he was caught cheating during a test. According to reports, some residents tried dissuading him from taking the extreme step when he went to the apartment building where his friend lived after sneaking out of his school.

188.title: Kerala govt to remove Governor Arif Mohammed Khan as universities' Chancellor
188.article_body: Kerala government on Wednesday decided to bring in an ordinance to remove Governor Arif Mohammed Khan as the Chancellor of state-run universities. The government is planning to appoint an expert from the education sector for the Chancellor's post. The decision came following several arguments between Khan and the state government in recent months over the administration of universities.

189.title: What is wrong with a fielder faking he has got the ball in his hands: Sunil Gavaskar
189.article_body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said that fake fielding should be considered as part of the deception that the game of cricket has. Gavaskar said that bowlers and batters try to deceive each other using various measures, adding, "Then what's wrong with a fielder faking he has got the ball in his hands when he actually doesn't have it."

190.title: Leave Twitter before it's too late: Actor Mark Ruffalo to Elon Musk
190.article_body: Actor Mark Ruffalo once again called out Elon Musk for his policies at Twitter and tweeted, "Leave Twitter before it's too late…never mind. It's too late. Billionaire Hubris syndrome." Ruffalo also criticised Musk for breaking his promise to keep Twitter "politically neutral" and recommending voting for Republicans. "He (Musk) speaks with a forked tongue," tweeted Ruffalo.

191.title: Twitter's top exec Yoel Roth once worked at an Apple store fixing Mac computers
191.article_body: Twitter's Head of Safety and Integrity Yoel Roth once worked at an Apple store fixing Mac computers and joined Twitter in 2015. While Roth has become the public face of Twitter's content moderation since Elon Musk took over, the latter also suggested people follow Roth’s Twitter feed for an "accurate" understanding of what’s happening with trust and safety at Twitter.

192.title: Robbers push passenger out of moving train in Bihar; 2nd incident in 4 days
192.article_body: A 34-year-old man, travelling in Tatanagar link Express, was pushed out of a moving train by armed robbers on Tuesday night between Barauni-Khagaria rail sections of Samastipur rail division, the police said. The victim was standing near the gate to de-board the train at Barauni when the incident happened. A similar incident occurred in Katihar-Barauni sections on November 5.

193.title: Sanjay, Sunny, Jackie and Mithun's 1st look from 'Baap' revealed; people say '80s are back'
193.article_body: The first look of Sanjay Dutt, Sunny Deol, Jackie Shroff and Mithun Chakraborty from the movie 'Baap' has been revealed. Reacting to the picture, social media users wrote, "I am loving the whole 80s action star vibes in this poster," and, "Dammmnnn the 90s me is getting legit excited." "This is going to be legendary," another user wrote.

194.title: 24-yr-old woman gets man arrested for molesting her twice in Mumbai Metro
194.article_body: A 24-year-old woman, with the help of another passenger, got a 29-year-old man arrested for molesting her twice inside the Mumbai Metro while she was on her way to work, police said. The accused bumped into the victim once, officials said, adding that he later stood behind the woman in the metro and sexually abused her.

195.title: Threw up every time SRK removed his shirt in 'Dard-E-Disco': Farah
195.article_body: Director-choreographer Farah Khan shared that during the filming of Om Shanti Om's 'Dard-E-Disco' song, she'd "throw up every time" Shah Rukh Khan would remove his shirt. She remembered that it was the first time when Shah Rukh showcased his six-pack abs on screen. Farah added that people said the film wouldn't work, but she was very sure about it.

196.title: He told me 'You've screwed us the most': Referee on sending Pique off
196.article_body: Discussing his decision to show a red card to Barcelona defender Gerard Pique in his final appearance for the club against Osasuna, referee Gil Manzano said, "Pique told me, 'You're the referee who's screwed us the most'." "Pique continued to repeat the same expressions...He said, 'It's a f***ing shame'," added Manzano. Pique was sent off from the bench at half-time.

197.title: Driffle raises $3.4 million in seed funding round led by BEENEXT
197.article_body: Digital gaming marketplace Driffle has secured $3.4 million in a seed round led by venture capital firm BEENEXT. Other investors including JAFCO Asia, Taurus Ventures, Better Capital and White Venture Capital raised funds. The funding round also saw participation from Cred Founder Kunal Shah, Global Chief Strategy Officer at OYO Maninder Gulati, StayVista Co-founder Amit Damani among others.

198.title: Bitcoin briefly falls to its lowest since Nov 2020 amid Binance-FTX deal
198.article_body: Bitcoin fell to $17,300.80 on Tuesday, the lowest level since November 2020, triggered by reports of the cryptocurrency exchange Binance taking over its rival FTX. Bitcoin rose by 6% initially following the takeover announcement but then fell as investors were worried about FTX’s balance sheet. Bitcoin was trading over 7% lower at $18,372.07 around 11.55 am on Wednesday, Coinbase showed.

199.title: Sanjay Raut gets bail in Patra Chawl money laundering case
199.article_body: A Mumbai court on Wednesday granted bail to Shiv Sena leader and MP Sanjay Raut in a money laundering case pertaining to the Patra Chawl redevelopment project. The Enforcement Directorate (ED) arrested Raut in July this year for his alleged role in financial irregularities in connection with the redevelopment of the Patra Chawl.

200.title: England have 65% chance of winning T20 WC semi-final vs India: Afridi
200.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi said England have a 60-65 per cent chance of winning their T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final against India. "I feel England's combination is extremely good," added Afridi. Former England captain Kevin Pietersen had earlier stated that he "really" thinks England will beat India in the semi-final, which is set to take place on November 10 (Thursday).

201.title: No effective climate policy without peace: Ukrainian President at COP27
201.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that there can be no effective climate policy without peace. In a video message played at the COP27 climate conference in Egypt, Zelenskyy highlighted the impact of the war on global energy supplies and food prices. "The Russian war destroyed five million acres of forests in Ukraine in less than six months," he added.

202.title: Next level fraudsters, says Paytm CEO while sharing scam text pic; Twitter users react
202.article_body: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma shared a screenshot of a fraudulent message he received that read 'Dr Larry Greens' from the USA is looking for a partner in India to supply raw materials. Sharma tweeted, "Next level fraudsters." Commenting on his post, some Twitter users shared screenshots of similar messages while one wrote, "Still some people will believe in India."

203.title: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia tests positive for COVID-19
203.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Tuesday said that he has tested positive for coronavirus. In a tweet, Scindia informed that he got tested for COVID-19 on the advice of doctors and the report has come positive. He has asked everyone who came in contact with him in the last few days to get themselves tested.

204.title: 'Har Har Mahadev' doesn't disrespect Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj: Makers
204.article_body: The makers of 'Har Har Mahadev' have released a statement to clarify that the film doesn't disrespect Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. "There's no intention or attempt to distort anyone's image or our glorious history," the statement read. The makers also condemned Nationalist Congress Party leader Jitendra Awhad's recent "act of attacking filmgoers" and said they trust the law and order system.

205.title: French firm PhotoRoom raises $19 mn in round led by Balderton Capital
205.article_body: France-based photo editing startup PhotoRoom has secured $19 million in Series A funding round led by Balderton Capital. Angel investors from Facebook, Hugging Face and Disney+ also participated in the funding round. The company was founded by Matthieu Rouif and Eliot Andres. PhotoRoom plans to use funds to develop its software, improve AI features and increase workforce in Europe.

206.title: If AAP wins MCD polls, garbage mountains in Delhi will disappear in 5 yrs: Dy CM
206.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Tuesday said people will vote for "jhaadu" in MCD elections to "clear garbage" of BJP. "If AAP comes to power in MCD, all mountains of garbage in Delhi will disappear in five years," Sisodia said after visiting Ghazipur landfill site. "CM...Kejriwal has made plan to remove mountains of garbage, trash from Delhi," he stated.

207.title: Minor arrested under POCSO Act for raping 13-yr-old girl in Hyd
207.article_body: A teenager and a 21-year-old man allegedly raped a schoolgirl in Hyderabad. The accused Rathan Lal and his teenage friend, who are the neighbours of the victim, took her on a joyride and after returning, both the accused raped the girl on terrace of Rathan's house. Police nabbed the teenager under POCSO Act and are searching for the prime accused.

208.title: Pics of Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport T2 go viral before inauguration
208.article_body: Photos showing the new Terminal 2 of Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru have gone viral. The terminal, built at a cost of around ₹5,000 crore, will be inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi on November 11. The terminal is designed as a tribute to the garden city of Bengaluru and the experience is meant to be a "walk in the garden".

209.title: Aruna Miller becomes 1st Indian-American Lieutenant Governor of US' Maryland
209.article_body: Aruna Miller on Tuesday scripted history by becoming the first Indian-American politician to win the race of Lieutenant Governor in the state of Maryland, US. "Maryland, you chose unity over division, expanding rights over restricting rights, and hope over fear," Miller said. She was born in Andhra Pradesh before migrating to the US along with her parents.

210.title: Pakistan, New Zealand announce their playing XIs for T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final
210.article_body: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson won the toss and elected to bat first in the first semi-final of T20 World Cup 2022 against Pakistan. Both New Zealand and Pakistan are fielding unchanged playing XIs. Pakistan have won 17 of the 28 T20Is played between the two sides. The match is taking place at the Sydney Cricket Ground.

211.title: He looked like typical star kid: Imtiaz Ali on Ranbir's first impression
211.article_body: Director Imtiaz Ali said when he saw Ranbir Kapoor as a kid, he looked like a "typical star kid, wearing formal clothes". "He had floppily straight hair and was looking very nervous and embarrassed," he recalled. Imtiaz said as an actor, Ranbir had a difficult journey in Bollywood, but he lived up to people's expectations.

212.title: Over 64,000 people die of snake bites in India per year, highest globally: Study
212.article_body: India accounts for almost 80% of global snake bite deaths, with over 64,000 people dying every year, according to a recent study conducted by a group of researchers from 22 countries. According to the study, UP, followed by MP and Rajasthan, reported highest number of deaths due to snake bites. Actual numbers are likely higher, snake bite treatment experts claimed.

213.title: What is the head-to-head record of Pakistan and New Zealand in T20I cricket?
213.article_body: Pakistan and New Zealand, who will face each other in T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final today, have played 28 T20Is against each other so far. Pakistan have won 17 matches, while New Zealand have won 11. In T20 World Cup history, Pakistan and New Zealand have faced each other six times, with Pakistan winning four times.

214.title: Russia is not reliable: US after Jaishankar says 'India will keep buying Russian oil'
214.article_body: A day after External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said that buying Russian oil worked to India's advantage and that it'll continue doing that, US State Department Spokesperson Ned Price said Russia isn't a reliable source of energy. Price added, "It isn't in the interest of the region or Ukraine but the collective interest for which India should decrease its dependence."

215.title: 'Major polluter' India must pay for climate damage: Island nations at climate summit
215.article_body: During the climate summit in Egypt, the Alliance of Small Island States said highly polluting emerging economies including India and China should pay into a climate compensation fund to help countries rebuild after climate change-driven disasters. The association described India and China as "major polluters". India's per capita emissions are significantly lower than world average.

216.title: 22-yr-old man arrested for social media post against Manipur CM & BJP
216.article_body: A 22-year-old man, Laishram Malemnganba, was arrested on Monday in Manipur for allegedly making derogatory remarks against CM N Biren Singh and BJP on Facebook, police said. Malemnganba was arrested from his house in Waiton in Imphal East district on the basis of a complaint lodged by state BJYM chief Manoharmayum Barish Sharma, police added.

217.title: Latest all-time T20I batting rankings released by ICC, 3 Indians in top 10
217.article_body: The ICC has released the latest all-time T20I batting rankings, with India's Suryakumar Yadav jumping to eighth position with 869 rating points. Virat Kohli (third with 897 rating points) and KL Rahul (tenth with 854 rating points) are the other two Indians to feature in the top 10. The all-time rankings are led by Dawid Malan, with 915 rating points.

218.title: Was doubted for choosing Deepika for 'Love Aaj Kal': Imtiaz Ali
218.article_body: Director Imtiaz Ali revealed that people doubted his decision to cast Deepika Padukone in 'Love Aaj Kal' as they didn't think she was a good actress. "She was supposed to be beautiful, not a good actor. She has changed that over the years," Imtiaz said. The director said both Deepika and Ranbir Kapoor enjoy acting and "really enjoy working together".

219.title: We'll do everything to ensure India-Pak final doesn't happen: Buttler
219.article_body: England captain Jos Buttler said his team will "do everything" they can to ensure that the T20 World Cup 2022 final doesn't witness a match between India and Pakistan. "India are a very, very strong team...There are fantastic players in their lineup," added Buttler. India will take on England in their T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final on Thursday.

220.title: FIR ordered against 'The Kerala Story' for showing state as ISIS terrorists' haven
220.article_body: Kerala DGP Anil Kant has directed to register an FIR against the crew of film 'The Kerala Story' for allegedly portraying the state as a safe haven of terrorists. The teaser of the movie claimed that over 32,000 Kerala women were converted and most of them were taken to Islamic State-held areas in Syria and Afghanistan in the last decade.

221.title: Democrat Wes Moore becomes 1st black Governor of US state of Maryland
221.article_body: Democrat Wes Moore has been elected as the first black Governor of the US state of Maryland. Moore defeated Republican Dan Cox, a first-term state legislator, who was endorsed by former President Donald Trump. Virginia's Douglas Wilder in 1989 and Deval Patrick of Massachusetts in 2006 were the only two black politicians to be elected Governor in the US.

222.title: India have been begging for more from Pant, he could surprise vs Eng: Lee
222.article_body: Ex-Australia pacer Brett Lee said India have been "begging for more" from Rishabh Pant, adding that he could spring a "surprise" with his performance in India's T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final against England. "Pant could be very, very dangerous...He might just be given that...license to go out and dominate [at] the top of the order," added Lee.

223.title: Tesla recalls over 40,000 cars facing power steering issues in US
223.article_body: Tesla is recalling over 40,000 2017-2021 Model S and Model X vehicles in US that may experience a loss of power steering assist when being driven on rough roads or after hitting a pothole. The recall requires an over-the-air software update. The Elon Musk-led automaker said as of November 1, 97% of the recalled vehicles have installed the new update.

224.title: India reports 811 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 13,559
224.article_body: India reported 811 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 625 fresh COVID-19 cases. The number of active cases in India went down to 13,559 from the earlier 14,021. The death toll so far has reached 5,30,511, according to the ministry.

225.title: Mumbai local train services hit due to signal failure
225.article_body: Mumbai local train services were hit after a signal failure was reported between Andheri and Jogeshwari stations on Wednesday. The snag was reported on Up and Down fast line of Western Railway at around 9.12 am but trains were running behind the schedule due to cascading effect, railway officials said. The trains are reportedly delayed by at least 20 minutes.

226.title: Wanindu Hasaranga becomes world number one T20I bowler, no Indian in top 10
226.article_body: Sri Lanka all-rounder Wanindu Hasaranga has become the world number one T20I bowler, as per the latest rankings. Hasaranga, who is the highest wicket-taker in T20 World Cup 2022 so far with 15 scalps, overtook Afghanistan's Rashid Khan in rankings. The 25-year-old is on top of rankings with 704 rating points. There is no Indian bowler in the top 10.

227.title: Thought Tabu hated The Crew's script, was elated when she said yes: Rhea
227.article_body: Producer Rhea Kapoor said that she thought Tabu "hated" the script of 'The Crew' as the actress didn't respond after the film's narration. She shared that when Tabu agreed to be on-board, she felt "super elated". She revealed that Kareena Kapoor Khan was "the first person" to be cast. "There is nobody else who can play this role," Rhea added.

228.title: Sherlyn Chopra 'producing filth', she is a menace to society: Raj Kundra
228.article_body: Calling actress-model Sherlyn Chopra a "menace to society", Raj Kundra said, "Who is she blaming for her own produced X rate content on OnlyFans that she has monetised...She will be arrested soon...matter of time." In October last year, Sherlyn had filed a complaint against Kundra and his wife, actress Shilpa Shetty, for fraud and mental harassment.

229.title: Bicycle rally organised in Pune to create voter awareness
229.article_body: A bicycle rally was flagged off by Chief Election Commissioner Rajiv Kumar in Pune on Wednesday to create awareness about voter registration as part of the national-level launch of a special summary revision of the voters' list. "The summary revision takes place every year...This year we are...starting it all over the country from Pune today," Kumar said.

230.title: Indigo Paints' stock falls by 6% after reports of ₹283-cr block deal
230.article_body: Shares of Indigo Paints dropped by 6% in Wednesday's early trade after 21 lakh shares, representing 4.4% equity, reportedly changed hands at ₹1,384 per unit. The transaction is valued at ₹283 crore. At 11:07 am, Indigo Paints' stock was trading 5.20% down at ₹1,414.90 apiece on the National Stock Exchange. The stock's 52-week low is ₹1,331 apiece.

231.title: Berkshire becomes 5th-biggest firm in S&P 500 Index after Tesla's $360-bn loss
231.article_body: After Elon Musk-led Tesla's stock lost $360 billion on Tuesday and closed with a market valuation of $604 billion, Warren Buffet's Berkshire Hathaway replaced the electric-vehicle maker as the fifth-biggest company in the S&P 500 Index. Berkshire's market valuation is nearly $645 billion. Apple, Microsoft, Alphabet and Amazon.com are the four biggest firms in the S&P 500 Index, respectively.

232.title: Pune police bust prostitution racket at spa, 2 women rescued
232.article_body: Pune City Police's Crime Branch busted a prostitution racket running under the garb of a spa and massage centre in Warje-Malwadi area. Police rescued two women and arrested the 25-year-old manager of the spa. A search has been launched for the owner. The women who have been rescued are from Maharashtra and were allegedly forced into prostitution, officials said.

233.title: Sack Tamil Nadu Governor, he has been instigating communal hatred: DMK to President
233.article_body: The DMK has said the party-led Secular Progressive Alliance has petitioned President Droupadi Murmu to sack Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi. Their memorandum said, "RN Ravi has violated the oath he took under Article 159 to preserve, protect and defend the Constitution...Far from it, he has been instigating communal hatred and is a threat to the peace of the state."

234.title: Feels like power move: Jennifer on why Ben shouldn't be called Mr Lopez
234.article_body: Singer-actress Jennifer Lopez said that her legal name will be Mrs Affleck but she doesn't want her husband Ben Affleck to be called Mr Lopez. "It's not traditional. It doesn't have any romance to it. It feels like it's a power move," she said. Lopez also spoke about Ben's ex-wife Jennifer Garner and called her "an amazing co-parent".

235.title: I'd love to buy Liverpool: Conor McGregor despite being Man Utd fan
235.article_body: Ex-UFC featherweight champion Conor McGregor took to Twitter to express his desire to buy Premier League club Liverpool, tweeting he'd "love" to buy the club despite being a fan of arch-rivals Manchester United. "I requested...information...[as] soon as I heard [about Liverpool being up for sale]," added McGregor. "I was attracted to the success...of Manchester United," he had earlier stated.

236.title: Maharashtra to have one sub-inspector post reserved for transgender
236.article_body: The Mumbai bench of the Maharashtra Administrative Tribunal (MAT) has directed the state government to reserve one post of sub-inspector for transgender persons in this year's selection process. MAT chairperson issued the order on Monday, saying that it was bound by the Supreme Court's 2014 judgment asking all state governments to have a reservation for transgenders for all public appointments.

237.title: IMA backs H’yana MBBS students protesting bond fee, condemns police action
237.article_body: The Indian Medical Association (IMA) extended its support to MBBS students in Haryana protesting state government's bond policy that mandated them to pay a bond fee of around ₹10 lakh during admission. IMA also condemned alleged police action against the students. "Students became a victim of barbaric police action...We request Haryana CM...that bond system be scrapped/modified," IMA said.

238.title: What will happen if India's T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final against England gets abandoned?
238.article_body: India will face England in their T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final in Adelaide on Thursday. In case, rain doesn't allow the match to be completed on Thursday, it'll continue on reserve day on Friday. If weather conditions lead to abandonment, India will reach final as they finished first in their Super 12 group, while England finished second in their group.

239.title: Pique denied final Barcelona appearance after getting sent off from bench at half-time
239.article_body: Barcelona defender Gerard Pique was denied the chance to make a final appearance for his club after getting sent off from bench at half time against Osasuna in a La Liga match. Pique was shown a red card after remonstrating with match officials. Pique was reportedly protesting against Robert Lewandowski being sent off earlier in the match.

240.title: US state of Maryland legalises marijuana, 4 other states vote
240.article_body: Voters in the US state of Maryland have approved legalisation of recreational marijuana, becoming 20th state to do so. Adults over 21 years of age will be allowed to possess up to 1.5 ounces of marijuana and will be permitted to grow two plants away from public view. Arkansas, Missouri, North Dakota and South Dakota are voting on the same.

241.title: India should be worried about facing Eng who are a better team: Vaughan
241.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said Team India should be "worried" about facing England in the upcoming T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final between the two teams, adding that England are a "better white-ball team". "95 per cent...[of the crowd will support India] and England generally love [such an] atmosphere," he stated. "India...do not bat aggressively enough early on," said Vaughan.

242.title: Five Star Business Finance's ₹1,960-crore IPO opens today
242.article_body: The IPO of Five Star Business Finance, which provides small business loans and mortgage loans to micro-entrepreneurs and self-employed individuals, opened on Wednesday and the subscription will close on Friday. The price band of the issue has been fixed at ₹450 to ₹474/equity share. It is an offer for sale of 4.1 crore shares aggregating to ₹1,960 crore.

243.title: Media needs to be vigilant, flag govt’s shortcomings: Manmohan Singh
243.article_body: The media needs to remain vigilant and flag shortcomings of the government with a view to improve the effectiveness of governance, ex-PM Manmohan Singh said on Tuesday. On the role of the media in a democracy, Singh said it has a very important contribution to make in the process of nation-building. He was speaking at the TIOL Heritage Award function.

244.title: Amitabh Bachchan says he used to fast on Karwa Chauth for Jaya Bachchan
244.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan revealed that he used to keep Karwa Chauth fast for his wife and actress Jaya Bachchan. In a conversation with a contestant on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 14', Big B said, "Shuru shuru me hum bhi rakhte the, fir chhod diye (I also used to fast initially, but then I stopped)." Amitabh and Jaya got married in 1973.

245.title: Why should I ignore hurtful comments: Sanjana on her 'chappal jaisi shakal' reply to troll
245.article_body: Sanjana Ganesan, who told a troll he has a "chappal-like face", wrote, "He instantly [deleted] the comment, [reported] my comment and [turned] his profile private." "If you're a troll and can't take one single negative comment...why am I expected to ignore...hurtful comments?" she added. The troll had commented, "You aren't beautiful enough for Jasprit Bumrah" on her post.

246.title: Anupam says Kirron Kher's 'cancer is in remission', calls her 'fighter'
246.article_body: Anupam Kher said Kirron Kher's recovery from cancer was the "biggest relief" and mentioned that her cancer "is in remission". Kirron was diagnosed with multiple myeloma in 2021. "She's a fighter...Giving up is not an option. Because you're known, you become a role model for people," he added. He shared that Kirron was "lucky to have wonderful doctors" in Mumbai.

247.title: Take criticism of collegium in positive light: Justice Chandrachud
247.article_body: Justice DY Chandrachud said criticism of the collegium system must be looked at in a "positive light" and attempts made to improve it. "While we work within the fold of that system…yet at the same time, there are several improvements which we can bring about because no institution in any constitutional democracy can lay claim to be perfect," he added.

248.title: Justice DY Chandrachud takes oath as the 50th Chief Justice of India
248.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Wednesday administered the oath of office to the new Chief Justice of India, Justice DY Chandrachud, at the Rashtrapati Bhavan. Justice DY Chandrachud is the 50th Chief Justice of India, succeeding Justice Uday Umesh Lalit. Justice Chandrachud will serve as the CJI for two years till November 10, 2024.

249.title: doola raises $8 mn in funding round led by Nexus Venture Partners
249.article_body: Fintech company doola, earlier known as StartPack, has raised $8 million in a funding round led by Nexus Venture Partners. It saw the participation of the Y Combinator Continuity Fund, among others. Arjun Mahadevan and JP Pincheira founded the startup in 2020 with its headquarters in New York City. doola helps its customers incorporate and access the US payment systems.

250.title: 1-on-1 mentorship is key to securing top tech roles: Scaler
250.article_body: Scaler shared that its learners prepare for in-demand tech roles by interacting one-on-one with seasoned tech professionals who help them set goals, understand complex concepts, get feedback, and stay motivated. Having worked at top tech companies, mentors share valuable insights from the industry that gives learners the extra edge to create a solid impact in their tech career, it added.

251.title: World's richest man Musk's net worth falls below $200 bn as Tesla shares decline
251.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk’s net worth dropped below $200 billion after Tesla shares hit a 52-week low on Tuesday. According to Forbes, this is only the second time since October 1, 2021, that Musk has been worth less than $200 billion. Tesla has seen its value fall by 14% since Musk completed the $44 billion acquisition of Twitter.

252.title: Delhi's air quality remains 'very poor' with 329 AQI; Noida's AQI at 269
252.article_body: Delhi's overall air quality on Wednesday morning was recorded in the 'very poor' category with an air quality index (AQI) of 329, as per the System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting And Research (SAFAR). Meanwhile, the air quality in Gautam Buddha Nagar was recorded in the 'poor' category with an AQI of 269 at around 9 am.

253.title: Maura Healey becomes 1st openly lesbian governor in US history
253.article_body: Maura Healey made history by becoming the first woman to be elected governor of Massachusetts and the first openly lesbian governor in US history. Healey, who was previously a civil rights lawyer, won the race against Republican Geoff Diehl. Jane Swift was first woman to fill Massachusetts Governor office in 2001, but she was appointed to the role, not elected.

254.title: Dropping Karthik for NZ tour during T20 WC 2022 wasn't right: Kaif
254.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said "dropping" Dinesh Karthik for India's tour of New Zealand during T20 World Cup 2022 wasn't right. "It affects the player...He feels the pressure. This...[has been] clearly seen in Karthik's case...The road ahead seems very difficult for Karthik," added Kaif. "Only Rishabh Pant will play now, irrespective of whether he does well or not," he stated.

255.title: Earthquake of magnitude 4.3 hits Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh
255.article_body: A 4.3-magnitude earthquake occurred in Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh at around 6.27 am on Wednesday. The depth of the earthquake was 5 km below the ground, the National Center for Seismology stated. This comes after Nepal was struck with an earthquake of 6.3-magnitude at around 2 am on Wednesday. The tremors were also felt across parts of Delhi-NCR.

256.title: Feel like a proud parent: Farah on 15 years of Deepika in Bollywood
256.article_body: Choreographer-director Farah Khan said she feels "like a proud parent" about actress Deepika Padukone, who completed 15 years in Bollywood today. "Whenever I go abroad and see people recognising her, I feel so proud...she has evolved and matured so much over the years," Farah said. Deepika made her Bollywood debut with Farah's 'Om Shanti Om', which released in 2007.

257.title: Pet-care startup Supertails raises $10 million in Series A funding
257.article_body: Tech-enabled pet-care startup Supertails raised $10 million in Series A round led by ﻿Fireside Ventures﻿, alongside existing investors ﻿Saama Capital﻿ and ﻿DSG Consumer Partners﻿. Other angel investors such as CRED Founder Kunal Shah, Genesis Luxury Fashion Founder and President Sanjay Kapoor, Mamaearth Co-founder and CEO Varun Alagh, among others also participated in the round.

258.title: Twitter to introduce 'Official' label for some verified accounts on launch of $8 plan
258.article_body: Twitter will introduce an "Official" label for selected verified accounts when it launches the $8 blue tick subscription service, said Twitter executive Esther Crawford. She added that not all previously verified accounts will get the "Official" label and that the label isn't available for purchase. Accounts that will receive it include government accounts, media outlets and some public figures.

259.title: 'The Crew' is my most fun & glamourous project yet: Rhea Kapoor
259.article_body: Filmmaker Rhea Kapoor called 'The Crew' her "most fun and glamorous project", starring Kareena Kapoor Khan, Kriti Sanon and Tabu. The film will be co-produced by Ekta Kapoor, who tagged Rhea as a filmmaker who "knows what she wants". "Rhea has a new, fresh, loud and clear voice...(in her) I found a creator I loved to align with," Ekta said.

260.title: My agent told Sir Alex not even a dog would sign deal he offered: Pogba
260.article_body: Discussing the contract he was offered by Manchester United's ex-manager Sir Alex Ferguson at 18, midfielder Paul Pogba said, "[My former agent] Mino Raiola told him that not even a dog would've [signed] it." "We stormed off, leaving him stunned," added Pogba. "Sir Alex arrived a little late [for] the meeting...We were waiting for him," he stated.

261.title: In pics: Last total lunar eclipse of 2022 from around the world
261.article_body: The world witnessed the last lunar eclipse of this year on Tuesday. It was the last total eclipse for the next three years because the next time this phenomenon will occur in March 2025. This gallery contains images of the eclipse from Mexico, El Salvador, China, Australia, Venezuela, Japan, Guatemala, and the last two photos are from Ranchi and Delhi.

262.title: BBMP chief sets November 15 deadline for filling potholes in B'luru
262.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath has set November 15 as the deadline to fill potholes within the municipal limits. Before this, the deadline was November 10. "Around 800-1,000 potholes are filled every day," Nath told the media on Tuesday. "Around 6,000-6,500 potholes are yet to be filled," a BBMP official said.

263.title: 6 killed as house collapses after 6.6-magnitude earthquake hits Nepal
263.article_body: Six people were killed after a house collapsed following an earthquake in Nepal. Nepal's seismological centre set the earthquake at a magnitude of 6.6, however, the United States Geological Survey pegged the earthquake at a magnitude of 5.6. Media reports after the quake showed tremors were also felt in New Delhi and surrounding areas.

264.title: Layoffs at Meta to begin on Wednesday, CEO Mark Zuckerberg tells staff: Report
264.article_body: Meta will begin laying off employees on Wednesday morning, said CEO Mark Zuckerberg, reported The Wall Street Journal. Zuckerberg reportedly addressed hundreds of workers on Tuesday and said he was accountable for the firm's missteps and that his overoptimism about growth led to overstaffing. Expected to affect thousands, the layoffs could be the most significant in the company's 18-year history.

265.title: Fire brigade short of 1,200 men in Mumbai; recruitment to start in Dec
265.article_body: The Mumbai Fire Brigade (MFB) is facing a shortage of 1,200 personnel and 100 drivers and it will take the department at least 10 months to be fully operational, a senior BMC official said. The fire brigade is supposed to run on a total strength of 3,500 men, he added. The recruitment for the fire department will start in December.

266.title: Rashmika shares post on 'receiving lot of hate', calls herself 'punching bag'
266.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna took to Instagram and wrote, "I have been on the receiving end of a lot of hate ever since I started my career. Quite literally a punching bag for a lot of trolls and negativity out there." "It's...demoralising when I'm being ridiculed and mocked by the internet especially for things that I have not said," she said.

267.title: Actor Leslie Phillips, who voiced Sorting Hat in Harry Potter films, passes away aged 98
267.article_body: British actor Leslie Phillips, known for his roles in the 'Carry On' comedies and voicing the Sorting Hat in Harry Potter movies, has passed away aged 98. Phillips' agent Jonathan Lloyd confirmed the star died peacefully in his sleep on Monday. The comic actor starred in more than 200 films, and TV and radio series over his eight-decade career.

268.title: US ticket-holder wins $2.04 billion in biggest lottery jackpot in world history
268.article_body: A ticket-holder in US' California won the $2.04-billion Powerball jackpot, believed to be the largest lottery jackpot in world history. The winning ticket was the only one to match all five white balls as well as the Powerball. The odds of matching all six numbers in the drawing were 1 in 292.2 million.

269.title: World Cup-bound referee shows 10 red cards in Argentina cup final
269.article_body: Referee Facundo Tello, who'll be officiating matches in the upcoming 2022 FIFA World Cup, handed out 10 red cards amid a brawl between Boca Juniors and Racing Club in Argentina's Champions Trophy final. Tello sent off seven Boca players and three from Racing, who won the match 2-1 in extra time. Two red cards were shown before full-time.

270.title: Norwegian princess quits royal duties to work with fiancé who is an American 'shaman'
270.article_body: Princess Märtha Louise of Norway has relinquished her royal duties to focus on her alternative medicine business with her fiancé Durek Verrett, who's a self-proclaimed American shaman. The palace said once they get married, Durek would become a member of the royal family but wouldn't have a title. Norwegian media had accused Märtha of using her title for commercial gain.

271.title: Elon Musk sells Tesla shares worth $3.95 billion after Twitter takeover
271.article_body: After taking over Twitter, Elon Musk has sold 19.5 million shares of Tesla worth $3.95 billion. With this sale, the total value of Tesla shares sold by Musk since he disclosed his stake in Twitter in April, reached nearly $20 billion. Earlier when he sold Tesla stock in April and August, he said there were no further sales planned.

272.title: Strong tremors felt in Delhi, North India as 6.3-magnitude earthquake hits Nepal
272.article_body: A 6.3-magnitude earthquake hit Nepal at around 2 am on Wednesday, as per the initial data by National Center for Seismology. The depth of the earthquake was around 10 km, as per preliminary data. Strong tremors were felt in Delhi-NCR and several other parts of North India. On Tuesday night, a 3.5-magnitude earthquake had also struck Nepal.

273.title: Focus on our things, not the negativity around: Leclerc to Ferrari F1
273.article_body: Ferrari F1 driver Charles Leclerc said the team needs to ignore criticism and focus on the job at hand. "I'm pretty sure that there's a lot of negativity around us...This is not going to help us go anywhere," said Leclerc. He added that F1 is a "very complex" sport and sometimes the criticism is "without any reasons".

274.title: K'taka govt withdraws circular to mobilise 6,500 students for PM's B'luru rally
274.article_body: Karnataka government's Pre University Education Department has withdrawn a circular directing colleges in Bengaluru to send students for PM Narendra Modi's rally in the city. Reacting to the circular which planned to mobilise 6,500 students, Congress spokesperson Nagaraj Yadav said, "Students should be in academic activity...not in rally." "What about their time for studying?" he added.

275.title: Indians are the largest foreign-born group in England, Wales: Data
275.article_body: Nearly one-sixth of the people living in England and Wales in 2021 were born outside the country, according to the census data. Indians constituted the largest group of people born outside England and Wales at 1.5%, followed by Poland (1.2%) and Pakistan (1%). In the UK, London was the region with the largest proportion of people born outside the country.

276.title: Economic reforms by Manmohan Singh gave new direction to India: Gadkari
276.article_body: Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari on Tuesday said the country is indebted to former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh for the economic reforms. Gadkari added that liberalisation policies implemented by Singh as finance minister in 1991 gave a new direction to India. "India needs a liberal economic policy with the intention to provide benefits to poor people," he further said.

277.title: Germany raids UBS offices in case involving Russian businessman
277.article_body: German police on Tuesday raided the offices of investment banking company UBS in connection with a money laundering case. The searches were linked to the same probe, involving a Russian businessman, that saw raids on a luxury yacht and more than 20 properties in September, prosecutors said. The subject of the investigation is believed to be Russian oligarch Alisher Usmanov.

278.title: European Union sanctions 19 more Myanmar officials
278.article_body: The European Union (EU) sanctioned 19 senior officials and armed forces personnel in Myanmar on Tuesday. The list includes the Foreign Economic Relations Minister, the Chief Justice, top military personnel and businessmen. These individuals are now banned from going to Europe and their assets have been frozen. With this, the EU in total has targeted 84 people and 11 'entities'.

279.title: Pakistan Police file FIR in Imran Khan's assassination bid
279.article_body: Pakistan's Punjab Police on Tuesday filed an FIR on the failed assassination attempt on former Prime Minister Imran Khan's life. The FIR was filed a day after Pakistan's apex court ordered the provincial police to register the case or face suo motu action. The detained attacker has been named the prime accused in the case.

280.title: Choosing Qatar to host WC was a mistake: Ex-FIFA President Blatter
280.article_body: FIFA's President at the time Sepp Blatter said picking Qatar to host the World Cup was a mistake 12 years ago. "It's a country that's too small...Thanks to the four votes of (then UEFA President Michel) Platini and his (UEFA) team, the World Cup went to Qatar," he said. Blatter added that he voted for the United States.

281.title: Don't visualise any problem from the BJP rebels: JP Nadda
281.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda said that he doesn't visualise any problem from their party rebels who are contesting in the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections. "When the campaign picks up, the voters understand that they have to vote for the party...Rebels will be further neutralised by the time of the election," Nadda said. However, Nadda admitted that the situation is unusual.

282.title: Winter session of Assam Legislative Assembly to start from Dec 20
282.article_body: According to a statement issued by the Assam Legislative Assembly Secretariat on Tuesday, the winter session of the Assembly will start from December 20. The session will be held at the Assembly Chamber in Dispur. As per the statement, Governor of Assam, Jagdish Mukhi, has summoned the session to meet at 9.30 am on December 20.

283.title: 50 middle school students fall ill after eating midday meal in Bihar
283.article_body: As many as 50 students of a middle school in Bihar's Bhojpur district fell ill after consuming midday meal on Tuesday, officials said. Many students complained of stomach ache and vomiting. The victims were admitted to hospital for treatment and their conditions are reportedly stable. Police said the school administration had given albendazole tablets to students after the meal.

284.title: Farcical: Imran Khan on FIR filed in assassination bid on him
284.article_body: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan on Tuesday described the FIR registered on the assassination attempt on him as "farcical". The FIR was filed on Tuesday after Pakistan's apex court ordered the provincial police to register the case or face suo motu action. Khan said he would express his position through his lawyers in the case.

285.title: I was replaced in a show as I had short hair after chemotherapy: Lisa Ray
285.article_body: Actress Lisa Ray, in a conversation with Humans of Bombay, opened up about her battle with cancer and revealed she was replaced in a travel show as she had short hair after chemotherapy. "They wanted a girl with 'long' hair. It was heartbreaking," she added. "I once tried wearing a wig for a public event...I found it...ridiculous," Lisa said.

286.title: Governors being used to encroach upon state govt powers: Kerala CM
286.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan accused the central government of using Governors in non-BJP-ruled states to 'encroach upon the powers of state governments'. "In many states, horse-trading of elected representatives is going on," said Vijayan. He further claimed that attempts were also being made to "financially choke" such states.

287.title: ASI, CRPF constable arrested in J&K police sub-inspector recruitment scam
287.article_body: An assistant sub-inspector (ASI) of Jammu and Kashmir Police and a constable of the CRPF are among the four people arrested by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) in the Jammu and Kashmir Police sub-inspector recruitment scam on Monday. So far, the CBI has arrested 13 people in the case, including security personnel and a teacher.

288.title: England need to win T20 World Cup to achieve greatness: Moeen Ali
288.article_body: All-rounder Moeen Ali said England needs to win more trophies to be considered a great limited-overs team. "It's important we start winning more as a team and as a country...Then we can call ourselves a top side," said Ali. He added that the team haven't performed well in the T20 World Cup so far and is hoping to correct it.

289.title: Armed group decamps with ₹20 lakh from Dera in Punjab's Hoshiarpur
289.article_body: Unidentified gunmen forcibly entered a dera and decamped with ₹20 lakh in cash in Punjab's Hoshiarpur on Tuesday. Around 45 people armed with pistols and sharp-edged weapons are reported to have broken into the dera. The group was led by Tarsem Singh and Satvir Singh, who are from Uttar Pradesh, said Deputy Superintendent of Police (Rural) Surinder Pal.

290.title: Man carries 3-yr-old's body for 65 kms on 2-wheeler after being refused ambulance
290.article_body: A video shows a man in Telangana's Khammam district carrying his three-year-old daughter's body on a two-wheeler after he was allegedly denied an ambulance by hospital staff. The child's parents were denied ambulance as there was no free ambulance service available at the time. The man carried his daughter's body for 65 kilometres as he couldn't afford a private ambulance.

291.title: Anand Marriage Act to be implemented in letter, spirit: Punjab CM
291.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Tuesday said the Anand Marriage Act, which seeks to give statutory recognition to Sikhs' 'Anand Karaj' marriage ceremony, will be implemented in letter and spirit. He said several states like Haryana and Tamil Nadu have already implemented the act. Mann pointed out that a notification to implement the act was issued in Punjab in 2016.

292.title: Boxer Nikhat Zareen recreates 'Saathiya Tune...' with Salman, shares video
292.article_body: CWG gold medallist Nikhat Zareen took to Twitter on Tuesday to share a video with Salman Khan. In the video, the boxer was seen recreating 'Saathiya Tune Kya Kiya' song with Salman. "Finallyyyyy intezar khatam hua (Finally, the wait is over) #fanmoment #dreamcometrue," Nikhat wrote. The song was a part of 'Love', a 1991 film which featured Salman and Revathi.

293.title: Wipro appoints Frederic Abecassis as BFSI head for Southeast Asia
293.article_body: IT company Wipro on Tuesday appointed Frederic Abecassis as the Head of Banking, Financial Services and Insurance (BFSI) Industry Sector, Southeast Asia. Prior to joining Wipro, Abecassis held various leadership roles with Capgemini Invent. According to Wipro, Abecassis, who is based in Hong Kong, will partner with and help clients achieve their core business and digital transformation goals.

294.title: UCC to be implemented throughout states: BJP chief JP Nadda
294.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda said the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) will be implemented at the state level. Calling the UCC an important issue, he said the ruling party has to run the country 'delicately'. "We have taken this issue state by state and have included it in the Himachal Pradesh manifesto," Nadda said.

295.title: No pressure on Congress workers to join Bharat Jodo Yatra: Kamal Nath
295.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Congress President Kamal Nath said there was no pressure on party workers to participate in Rahul Gandhi's ongoing Bharat Jodo Yatra. "Despite that, all party workers will join it with their hearts," said Nath. He added that the Yatra did not have any political objective but was launched as "our cultural and constitutional institutions are in danger".

296.title: Will focus on sanity, not vanity if Congress wins Guj: Chidambaram
296.article_body: Former Finance Minister P Chidambaram said if the Congress comes to power in Gujarat, it won't focus on "vanity projects" like the bullet train or Central Vista project. "Every pie should be weighed and spent...You must spend only on sanity projects," said Chidambaram. He added that a government should focus on the needs of the poor like "jobs, houses, water".

297.title: Renault to split into 5 divisions, spin-off EV unit
297.article_body: French automaker Renault on Tuesday announced its plans to split its activities into five businesses. It'll spin-off its electric vehicles unit, codenamed Ampere, with a stock market listing. Further, its combustion-engines unit will be housed in a joint venture with Chinese rival Geely. Its other businesses will cover the Alpine sports car brand, financial services and new mobility products.

298.title: 3 people, including 2 children, drown after boat capsizes in UP
298.article_body: A boat carrying 20 people capsized in Uttar Pradesh, killing three people including two children, police said. UP CM Yogi Adityanath told officials to provide help to the affected families and District Magistrate Avinash Kumar announced ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh each to the relatives of the deceased. Among those on the boat, 13 people swam to safety.

299.title: ICC names 10 best catches in Super 12 stage of T20 World Cup 2022
299.article_body: ICC has named 10 best catches in the Super 12 stage of T20 World Cup 2022. It includes Netherlands' Roelof van der Merwe's catch to dismiss David Miller. Catches taken by England's Liam Livingstone, Jos Buttler and Adil Rashid also featured. Babar Azam, Rashid Khan,  Ashen Bandara, Glenn Phillips, Ryan Burl and Rilee Rossouw's catches were also included.

300.title: Lewis Hamilton becomes Brazil's honorary citizen, says 'I feel like now I'm one of you'
300.article_body: Seven-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton has been made an honorary citizen of Brazil. Hamilton dedicated the honour to his boyhood idol, late Brazilian Formula One world champion Ayrton Senna.  "I feel like now I'm one of you," the Mercedes driver said in a session of Brazil's lower house of Congress.

301.title: Indian players to remain away from overseas leagues: IPL Chairman Arun Dhumal
301.article_body: New IPL Chairman Arun Dhumal has stated that contracted Indian players will remain away from overseas leagues. "This in principle is the decision of BCCI... As it is there is so much of cricket happening. Keeping in mind their overall well-being that decision has been taken. As of now we stick to that decision," he added.

302.title: 2 teens run over by train while taking selfie on tracks in Bengal
302.article_body: Two teenagers were run over by a local train while clicking a selfie on railway tracks in West Bengal's Howrah district, Government Railway Police said on Tuesday. The incident took place near Mahishrekha bridge between Kulgachia and Bagnan railway stations on Monday night. The bodies were recovered and handed over to their parents after post-mortem examination, an official said.

303.title: Elephant dies after getting electrocuted in Assam's Nagaon
303.article_body: An adult elephant died of electrocution in Assam's Nagaon district on Tuesday. The incident happened after the elephant strayed into a locality and came in contact with a high-voltage wire that was hanging low, forest officials said. The deceased elephant, which was first spotted by locals at Borholla village, was buried by forest officials with the help of locals.

304.title: 2 US police officers charged after car with handcuffed woman hit by train
304.article_body: Two police officers in US' Colorado state were charged with multiple offences on Monday for allegedly leaving a handcuffed woman in a patrol car parked on railway tracks, where it was struck by a freight train. Yareni Rios-Gonzalez (20) was seriously injured in the incident. She was placed in the car after being detained for an alleged road rage incident.

305.title: Brazil's Pedro proposes to girlfriend minutes after being selected for FIFA World Cup
305.article_body: Brazilian striker Pedro Guilherme proposed to his girlfriend minutes after being named in Brazil's squad for 2022 FIFA World Cup. The 25-year-old shared pictures after getting engaged and wrote, "God is so good, so grateful to God for having this woman in my life. Thank you for making me grow in every area most especially as a man of God."

306.title: Union Minister Anurag Thakur pushes bus to clear jam in Himachal, video surfaces
306.article_body: Union Sports Minister Anurag Thakur was seen pushing a bus that had broken down in the middle of the road in Himachal Pradesh's Bilaspur, causing a traffic jam. The minister was seen participating in efforts to clear the road after his convoy got stuck. Thakur, whose father is a former Himachal CM, is in the state for poll rallies.

307.title: Leslie Phillips, voice of Sorting Hat in 'Harry Potter' films, passes away
307.article_body: Leslie Phillips, the British actor who voiced the Sorting Hat in 'Harry Potter' films, passed away aged 98. His agent, Jonathan Lloyd, said that he died "peacefully at home" on Monday. Leslie's wife Zara said, "I've lost a wonderful husband and...public has lost a truly great showman." Leslie was also known for his roles in the 'Carry On' comedy films.

308.title: EU opens investigation into Microsoft's $69 bn Activision bid
308.article_body: European Union antitrust regulators opened an investigation into Microsoft's $69 billion bid for 'Call of Duty' maker Activision Blizzard. The regulatory commission said that the transaction may distort competition in the market and it is concerned that Microsoft may not provide access to Activision's console and PC video games. Microsoft announced the agreement to buy Activision in January.

309.title: PM Modi is popular in world, nobody has leadership qualities like him: Nadda
309.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda said that PM Narendra Modi is popular across the world and nobody has leadership qualities like him. "There is no second thought that PM Modi is our most towering personality," Nadda said in an interview. He added, "It is our pride that he is our commander and PM Modi has personal bonding with Himachal Pradesh."

310.title: 27 girls missing from Rajasthan village, says NCPCR; orders probe
310.article_body: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) Chairperson Priyank Kanoongo said that a probe has been ordered over 27 girls who went missing from their village in Rajasthan. The village has been allegedly selling girls on government stamp papers. Kanoongo visited the village after a notice was issued to the Rajasthan government on the reported auctioning of girls.

311.title: 2 drug smugglers arrested in J&K's Udhampur, 27 kg poppy seized
311.article_body: Two inter-state drug smugglers were arrested on Tuesday in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district and 27 kg of poppy was seized from their possession, officials said. The arrests were made after a truck was intercepted at Jakhani Chowk on the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway. Truck driver Sukhdev Singh and his accomplice Harpreet Singh were arrested.

312.title: MBBS, BDS seats reserved for children of terror victims in J&K
312.article_body: The Centre has decided to reserve seats in MBBS and BDS courses for the spouse and children of terrorist victims in Jammu and Kashmir. Seats will be reserved from the central pool for academic year 2022-23. Children whose both parents were killed by terrorists would get the first priority, followed by children of families whose sole bread earners were slain.

313.title: 2023-24 PL season to start on August 12, mid-season break in Jan 2024
313.article_body: The 2023-24 Premier League season will start on August 12 and will have a mid-season player break from January 13 to 20, 2024. "In keeping with commitments made to clubs this season...no two rounds in this period will take place within 48 hours of each other," said the league in a statement. The season will end on May 19, 2024.

314.title: Remove 50% reservation cap, hold nationwide caste census: Nitish
314.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar demanded that the cap of 50% on reservations be removed and a nationwide caste census be conducted in India. "The cap is depriving OBCs and EBCs (economically backward class) of opportunities in proportion to their population," said Kumar. He also welcomed the Supreme Court's decision to uphold the 10% reservation for the Economically Weaker Sections (EWS).

315.title: Ex-IPS officer launches Hindutva-based political party in Gujarat
315.article_body: Ex-IPS officer DG Vanzara on Tuesday launched a party called Praja Vijay Party (PVP), which will contest the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. Calling the PVP a "Hindutva party", Vanzara said, "People of Gujarat don't easily accept a non-Hindutva party. Only a Hindutva party can provide an alternative to the BJP." Notably, Vanzara was earlier acquitted in cases of extrajudicial killings.

316.title: Editors Guild calls Kerala Guv expelling journalists from press meet 'arbitrary act'
316.article_body: Editors Guild of India said Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan expelling journalists of two news channels from a press conference in Kochi was an "arbitrary act". The Guild said it was "deeply disturbed" by this selective targeting of media channels by a person "who is supposed to be guardian of democratic values". "Media has right to be critical," it added.

317.title: Salman scrapped everything I shot on day 1 during Dabangg 2 shoot: Arbaaz
317.article_body: Actor Arbaaz Khan, who directed 'Dabangg 2', revealed he had 40 shots lined up on the first day of the shoot. He added, "Brother Salman Khan let me go by the book and do it. I thought, 'Wow, what an obedient actor'." Arbaaz revealed Salman scrapped everything they shot on the first day. "He decided to rattle me," Arbaaz stated.

318.title: I'm a darling of the people, BJP troubled by it: Delhi CM Kejriwal
318.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said that he was "the darling of the people" and BJP was 'troubled' by the love he was getting. "Before Punjab elections, PM said Kejriwal is a terrorist...Now, before Gujarat and the MCD polls, they are saying Kejriwal is corrupt," he said. Kejriwal added that he should be arrested if he is corrupt or a terrorist.

319.title: World's largest cryptocurrency exchange Binance to buy its rival FTX
319.article_body: Binance, the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange, has signed a non-binding letter of intent to acquire rival crypto exchange FTX. "This afternoon, FTX asked for our help. There's a significant liquidity crunch," Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao said, while FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried tweeted, "Things have come full circle." The deal was announced after a public feud between the two CEOs.

320.title: Sanjana Ganesan responds after troll says 'You aren't beautiful enough for Bumrah'
320.article_body: Sanjana Ganesan has responded to an Instagram user after the troll commented on one of her pictures. "[Ma'am] you are not that beautiful, how did you impress Jasprit Bumrah?" the troll had written. Replying to this, Ganesan commented, "Aur khud jo chappal jaisi shakal lekar ghoom rahe ho uska kya? (What about your chappal-like face?)"

321.title: People misunderstood my comment about not taking ex's calls: Ishaan
321.article_body: Actor Ishaan Khatter has said that people misunderstood his statement during 'Koffee With Karan 7' about not taking his ex-girlfriend's calls for two weeks. "People thought I was talking about my last relationship and that's not what that was. It was a relationship. I said it in context to a relationship and I don't regret it," he added.

322.title: 2 women killed in road accident in UP's Baghpat
322.article_body: Two women died after being hit by an unidentified vehicle on the Delhi-Saharanpur national highway in Baghpat, UP on Tuesday. The incident occurred when the deceased, Mukesh Devi (50) and Usha (63), were crossing the highway, police said. Both, Usha and Devi were residents of Katha village, police added. Notably, the accused driver is absconding.

323.title: By-election in UP's Khatauli on December 5 after MLA disqualified
323.article_body: The Election Commission on Tuesday said the by-election to the Khatauli Assembly seat in Uttar Pradesh will be held on December 5. The by-election was necessitated following BJP MLA Vikram Singh's conviction last month in a case connected with the 2013 Muzaffarnagar riots. Singh, who was sentenced to two years in jail, was also disqualified as a legislator.

324.title: Hinduism not a religion, it's a way of life: Former BJP MP Katti
324.article_body: A video of former BJP MP Ramesh Katti allegedly stating "Hinduism is not a religion" has gone viral. "Hinduism is a way of life...There is no Hindu faith. It is a usage," Katti reportedly says in the video. Earlier, Karnataka Congress leader Satish Jarkiholi claimed that the term 'Hindu' is of Persian origin and that the meaning "is very dirty".

325.title: US seeing no credible threat of midterms disruption: Official
325.article_body: US officials are not seeing any credible threats aimed at the country's voting machines or poll books during the midterm elections, a senior federal cybersecurity official told reporters on Tuesday. Notably, as per a report made public in 2019, US officials found evidence of Russian interference aimed at marring Hillary Clinton's chances against Donald Trump in the 2016 presidential elections.

326.title: Big B, Kamal Haasan, Rajinikanth: 'KGF' actor Yash on his inspiration
326.article_body: Actor Yash opened up about the actors he draws inspiration from. He named actors Shankar Nag, Ambareesh, Dr Rajkumar, Amitabh Bachchan, Rajinikanth, Kamal Haasan and Clint Eastwood. Yash, who featured in the 'KGF' franchise, will next be seen in the project that is tentatively named 'Yash 19'. The film will reportedly be directed by Narthan.

327.title: Kareena, Tabu & Kriti to star in Rhea Kapoor's comedy film 'The Crew'
327.article_body: Kareena Kapoor Khan, Tabu and Kriti Sanon are all set for their maiden collaboration in a film titled 'The Crew'. Produced by Ektaa Kapoor and Rhea Kapoor, it is said to be a comedy set against the backdrop of the airline industry. 'The Crew' will be directed by Rajesh Krishnan and it will go on floors in February 2023.

328.title: Anyone can lead Congress in Himachal, new leaders ready: Surjewala
328.article_body: Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said that after election results are announced in Himachal Pradesh, anybody can lead the party there as a new line of leadership has emerged. Calling AICC General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi the face of elections in Himachal, he said that she will be spearheading the campaign. Elections in Himachal will be held on November 12.

329.title: Assam policeman, 3 doctors arrested for teen's rape-murder cover-up
329.article_body: Three government doctors and an ASP rank police officer have been arrested by the Assam CID for allegedly covering up the rape and murder of a 13-year-old domestic help, officials said on Tuesday. The victim's body was reportedly found hanging at an SSB jawan's house in the Darrang district in June. She was allegedly raped and murdered by the jawan.

330.title: Sunny Leone's pic appears on hall ticket of K'taka govt exam candidate, probe ordered
330.article_body: The hall ticket of a Karnataka Teacher Eligibility Test (TET) candidate carried the picture of actress Sunny Leone, following which an inquiry was ordered by the state education department. A picture of the improper hall ticket was shared on Twitter by Karnataka Congress social media chairperson BR Naidu. State School Education Minister BC Nagesh said candidates upload their own photos.

331.title: FIFA shares pic of Messi, Ronaldo, Neymar cutouts in river; says 'WC fever has hit Kerala'
331.article_body: FIFA took to its official Twitter account and shared a picture of cutouts of Cristiano Ronaldo, Neymar and Lionel Messi in a local river in Kerala. "FIFA World Cup fever has hit Kerala," FIFA wrote. The 2022 FIFA World Cup will begin on November 20 in Qatar. It'll be the first time that World Cup will take place in winter.

332.title: Unforgivable crime: Ex-K'taka CM on Lingayat seer rape allegations
332.article_body: Former Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa on Tuesday, while referring to Lingayat seer Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru, said, "The whole world today knows that he has committed an unforgivable offence." The seer has been accused of raping minor girls in Chitradurga. "Nobody had expected that he would stoop this low. Everyone should condemn this and he should be punished," Yediyurappa said.

333.title: Under ED probe, ex-Surat VP quits BJP alleging 'vindictive attitude'
333.article_body: PVS Sarma, a former Vice-President of BJP's Surat city unit, resigned on Tuesday alleging that he had been "treated badly with a vindictive attitude" since CR Paatil became the party's Gujarat President. According to Sarma, the BJP state unit under Paatil miserably failed to protect and support the karyakartas who worked tirelessly for the people and the party.

334.title: Kartik Aaryan & Luv Ranjan to reunite for Pyaar Ka Punchnama 3: Report
334.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan and filmmaker Luv Ranjan will reportedly reunite for 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama 3'. The duo previously worked together in the 2015 film 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama 2'. "They have been toying around with multiple ideas over the years...Luv will dive into developing this post the release of Ranbir Kapoor and Shraddha Kapoor's next in March," a source said.

335.title: Jagannath Temple body to pay ₹12 crore for illegal mining on its land
335.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has ordered the Jagannath Temple administration to pay ₹12 crore to the Odisha government for allowing illegal stone quarrying on land belonging to the temple in Khordha district. The administration has been asked to deposit the money with Khordha District Collector for restitution, reclamation and renovation of the excavated areas within the next four months.

336.title: Rahul staying away from Himachal due to fear of defeat: Prasad
336.article_body: BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad said Rahul Gandhi is staying away from campaigning in Himachal Pradesh to 'avoid responsibility for Congress' defeat'. "Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi are not coming because they understand what the result is going to be," said Prasad. He added that Congress lost the bypoll in Telangana despite the Bharat Jodo Yatra crossing the state.

337.title: Quona Capital announces close of 3rd fund at $332 mn
337.article_body: Venture capital firm Quona Capital has announced the close of its third fund at $332 million which it will use to continue investing in various emerging markets such as India and Southeast Asia. At its close, the fund exceeded its target of $250 million. The Washington DC-headquartered firm has invested in Indian startups such as ZestMoney, IndiaMart among others.

338.title: Pocket FM clocks $25 mn annualised revenue run-rate, forays into US
338.article_body: Audio streaming platform Pocket FM announced its international expansion and entry into the United States market. The company has exceeded $25 million ARR (Annualised Revenue Run-rate) as recorded until October 2022. With the introduction of micro-payment, the platform has registered a 10X revenue growth during the fourth year of operations with 500,000+ monthly transactions, the startup said.

339.title: Adidas appoints ex-Puma chief Bjorn Gulden as new CEO
339.article_body: Adidas appointed former Puma head Bjorn Gulden as its next CEO effective January 1, 2023. Current CEO Kasper Rorsted will step down on Friday, Adidas said. This came after Adidas recently terminated its Yeezy partnership following antisemitic remarks from the rapper-designer Ye, formerly known as Kanye West. Yeezy accounted for nearly half of the company's total profits in recent years.

340.title: MK Stalin calls all-party meet on November 12 over EWS verdict
340.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin called for an all-party meeting on November 12 over the Supreme Court's verdict providing 10% reservation for economically weaker sections (EWS). The meet will be held at the secretariat and two representatives from each legislative party will be invited to participate. Stalin called the verdict a setback in the struggle for social justice.

341.title: US photographer treks 165 km to capture images of snow leopard in Nepal, pics viral
341.article_body: US-based photographer Kittiya Pawlowski, while sharing an Instagram post, revealed she undertook a journey of 165 km on foot to reach Khumbu Valley in Nepal in an attempt to photograph  snow leopards. "After walking through Earth's most forbidding terrain, lung-starving altitudes—this was the most...rewarding set of photos I've ever taken," she wrote. "This is stunning," a comment read.

342.title: Video shows in-laws beating woman for breaking husband's leg in MP
342.article_body: A video has surfaced showing a woman being assaulted by her in-laws for allegedly breaking her husband's leg in MP's Gwalior. In the video, eight-nine people can be seen kicking and punching the woman. The woman has accused six people, including her husband, of assault and torture and the police have registered an FIR against both sides.

343.title: 'RRR' is most well-executed, spectacular movie: 'The Lunchbox' director
343.article_body: Filmmaker Ritesh Batra, who directed the 2013 film 'The Lunchbox', took to Twitter and praised SS Rajamouli's 'RRR'. He tweeted, "'RRR' is the most well-executed, spectacular movie I've seen in a long long time!" He added that the film is a must-watch in a theatre. "Believe the hype! Rajamouli makes us so proud," Ritesh added.

344.title: 'Mister Mummy' release postponed, film to clash with 'Drishyam 2'
344.article_body: The release date of Riteish Deshmukh and Genelia Deshmukh-starrer 'Mister Mummy' has been postponed. The film, which was earlier scheduled to release on November 11, will now arrive in theatres on November 18. The Shaad Ali directorial will clash with Ajay Devgn and Tabu's thriller 'Drishyam 2' at the box office.

345.title: Ghazal Alagh, Namita on Forbes' 20 powerful businesswomen in Asia list
345.article_body: On Forbes Asia's 20 powerful businesswomen list, three Indians, whose businesses soared despite COVID-19, were featured. Chairperson of Steel Authority of India Ltd (SAIL), Soma Mondal; Executive Director (India Business) of Emcure Pharma, Namita Thapar and Co-founder & Chief Innovation Officer of Honasa Consumer, Ghazal Alagh are on the list. Forbes said that the women are newcomers to the list.

346.title: Body shaming starts at home, mom constantly told me to lose weight: Sonakshi
346.article_body: Actress Sonakshi Sinha in an interview recalled how she faced body shaming at home and said her mother constantly asked her to lose weight. "When somebody was...saying that to you, the rebellious kid in me would always do...opposite and...the day my mother stopped telling me that's when it actually struck me...I need to do something about my weight," she added.

347.title: 'Spunky' schoolgirl confronts K'taka IAS officer for extra library hrs
347.article_body: A schoolgirl on Monday asked Karnataka IAS officer LK Atheeq to extend timings of gram panchayat community libraries to eight hours per day. The Additional Chief Secretary of Karnataka rural development department shared a video of the incident.
