The officer tweeted, "When I visited a GP library...I was confronted by this spunky young girl, ready with a petition she wrote."

348.title: Journalist killed in Kenya was targeted, claims Pak minister
348.article_body: Pakistan's Interior Minister, Rana Sanaullah, said on Tuesday evidence suggested that Pakistani journalist Arshad Sharif, who was shot dead in Kenya, was the victim of a targeted killing. The incident occurred on October 23 on the outskirts of Nairobi. The vehicle Sharif was travelling in came under fire from police as it drove through a roadblock, Kenyan police had said.

349.title: Team India players dine at 'British Raj' restaurant ahead of T20 WC semi against England
349.article_body: Team India players and their partners dined at 'British Raj' restaurant in Adelaide ahead of their T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final against England, which will take place on Thursday. "Three days in Adelaide is like bliss...It was a team bonding exercise also and a chance to completely unwind,"   a senior BCCI official told PTI.

350.title: Suryakumar's diet built on a 5-point agenda, cheat meals are rare: Dietitian
350.article_body: Dietitian Shweta Bhatia, who worked with Suryakumar Yadav on his diet for the past year, said the cricketer's diet was built on a five-point agenda. His diet was planned to help him boost performance, maintain body fat, remain cognitively alert/energetic, reduce the need to refuel constantly and promote recovery. Cheat meals are a rarity and planned strategically, Bhatia said.

351.title: Shivnarine Chanderpaul, 2 others inducted into ICC Hall of Fame
351.article_body: ICC on Tuesday announced three new additions to the ICC Hall of Fame, with former West Indies captain Shivnarine Chanderpaul, former Pakistan spinner Abdul Qadir and former England Women captain Charlotte Edwards being the latest inductees. Chanderpaul scored 20,988 runs for West Indies between 1994 and 2015, while Qadir took 368 international wickets. Charlotte scored 10,273 international runs.

352.title: Centre releases ₹7,183 crore as revenue deficit grant to 14 states
352.article_body: Ministry of Finance on Monday released the eighth monthly instalment of Post Devolution Revenue Deficit (PDRD) Grant of ₹7,183.42 crore to 14 states, including Andhra Pradesh, Rajasthan, Assam and Punjab. With this, the amount released in FY23 stands at ₹57,467.33 crore. The Fifteenth Finance Commission has recommended a total PDRD grant of ₹86,201 crore for the FY23.

353.title: TN targets ₹75,000-cr investment in aerospace, defence over 10 years
353.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Tuesday released the Aerospace and Defence Industrial Policy, 2022, which targets nearly ₹75,000 crore investments in the next ten years. The policy aims to provide enhanced support to the micro, small and medium enterprises sector and startups engaged in the two sectors. The government plans to create over one lakh jobs.

354.title: Karnataka cabinet expansion likely after Gujarat polls: CM Bommai
354.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said the cabinet expansion in the state is likely after the Gujarat Assembly elections due in December. "Cabinet expansion...I have already spoken...our leadership is a bit busy with the Gujarat elections, as soon as it is over they will call me (for discussions)," Bommai said. The cabinet expansion was reportedly going to fill six vacant posts.

355.title: Madrassa students should become officers, not Maulvis: UP Minister
355.article_body: UP minister Dharam Pal Singh said Madrassa students in the state will be taught math and science, among other subjects, so that they become "officers" instead of "maulvis". Singh said he is following the PM's vision of 'Quran in one hand and laptop in the other'. He added that schools and hospitals will be built by vacating Waqf Board land.

356.title: I-T Dept raids 2 J'khand Cong MLAs, detects ₹100 cr unaccounted transactions
356.article_body: Income Tax Department has detected unaccounted transactions worth over ₹100 crore after it raided Jharkhand Congress MLAs, Kumar Jaimangal and Pradeep Yadav, and their alleged associates. The Department also said that 50 premises in Jharkhand, Bihar, Gurugram (Haryana) and West Bengal were covered during searches. Based on preliminary analysis, concerned people engaged in tax evasion, it added.

357.title: No one has talked to me about it: Rajkummar Rao on 'Stree 2'
357.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao, who featured in the 2018 film 'Stree', has said that a sequel to the film should be made as it was "a good and hit film". "I have not given any official statement regarding the film because no one has talked to me about it yet," he added. This comes after actress Shraddha Kapoor confirmed 'Stree 2'.

358.title: Over 42 million early votes cast in run-up to US midterm elections
358.article_body: More than 42 million Americans cast early votes in the run-up to Tuesday's midterm elections, the US Elections Project said on Monday. According to the website, 39.1 million early votes had been cast by the same point in the 2018 midterms. The US went to polls on Tuesday to elect 435 House of Representatives members and one-third of the Senate.

359.title: Rohit is big-match player, likes playing against Eng: Kaif ahead of SF
359.article_body: Ahead of the India-England semifinal match on Thursday, ex-cricketer Mohammad Kaif said that Indian skipper Rohit Sharma is a "big-match player" and likes playing against England. "I will not be surprised at all if Rohit scores big in that semifinal...whenever there is pressure, he plays a match-winning knock...The next match is the biggest one for Rohit as captain," Kaif said.

360.title: Elon Musk considering putting all of Twitter behind a paywall: Reports
360.article_body: Elon Musk is reportedly considering putting all of Twitter behind a paywall in an effort to monetise the site. Musk discussed the idea with tech investor David Sacks, who's helping him at Twitter, in recent meetings, Platformer reported. One such plan might allow all users to browse Twitter for free only for a limited amount of time per month.

361.title: 2 women beaten, their private parts burnt for being in lesbian relationship in WB
361.article_body: Two women, who are in a lesbian relationship, were beaten and their private parts were burnt with hot rods by three men in West Bengal's Murshidabad district. One of the accused has been arrested, while search is on to arrest the rest, police said. Two of the accused are relatives of the victims, as per reports.

362.title: Had pleasure of being in Arshdeep's company in Punjab Kings: Andy Flower
362.article_body: Ex-Zimbabwe skipper Andy Flower said that the world has known less about Indian pacer Arshdeep Singh. "I had the pleasure of being in his (Arshdeep) company when I was with Punjab Kings (PBKS) and he was a youngster coming through," Flower said. "You could always see his potential, not only in his physicality...but in his attitude," the 54-year-old ex-cricketer added.

363.title: INC means 'I need chori': BJP on Congress using KGF music in Yatra
363.article_body: Criticising Congress for illegally using 'KGF: Chapter 2' music during 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla said, "Once a thief, always a thief". "INC does not stand for Indian National Congress," he said, adding that it stands for "I need chori". On Monday, a Bengaluru court ordered Twitter to temporarily block the accounts of Congress and Bharat Jodo Yatra.

364.title: Demonetisation was move by 'PayPM' for billionaire friends: Rahul
364.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday criticised PM Narendra Modi over demonetisation, saying it was a deliberate move by 'PayPM' to ensure that two-three of his billionaire friends monopolise India's economy. Congress' Gourav Vallabh, on the sixth anniversary of demonetisation, called it the "death anniversary of the Indian economy", adding that it was independent India's greatest loot.

365.title: K'taka HC stays order to block Congress, Bharat Jodo Yatra Twitter handles
365.article_body: The Karnataka High Court on Tuesday set aside a trial court's order to block the Indian National Congress (INC) and Bharat Jodo Yatra's Twitter handles over the alleged unauthorised use of music from the film 'KGF: Chapter 2'. The order is subject to Congress party "taking down the offending material" from social media before noon on Wednesday, the HC said.

366.title: 54-year-old woman dies after being run over by Vande Bharat Express in Gujarat
366.article_body: A 54-year-old woman died after being run over by Mumbai-bound Vande Bharat Express train near Anand Railway Station in Gujarat on Tuesday, Railway Police said. The victim, identified as Beatrice Archibald Peter, was crossing the track when the accident took place at 4.37 pm, an official said. The official added that the matter is under investigation.

367.title: Samantha will emerge victorious in her battle with myositis: Mukundan
367.article_body: Actor Unni Mukundan, who will feature in 'Yashoda' alongside Samantha Ruth Prabhu, has said that the actress will emerge victorious in her battle against myositis. "She is very hardworking and committed. She never spoke about her health or anything related to it and it comes as a shocker to me," he further added. Samantha revealed about myositis on Instagram.

368.title: Shot for song 'Chhori' when I was down with 102-degree fever: Nikki
368.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 14' fame Nikki Tamboli has revealed that she shot for her upcoming music video 'Chhori' when she was down with 102-degree fever. "But I kept going as I am very passionate when it comes to my work and my love for dance," she added. Nikki further said shooting for 'Chhori' was a memorable experience for her.

369.title: Probe launched after girl confined for over 7 years freed in Germany
369.article_body: German prosecutors have launched an investigation into the case of an eight-year-old girl who was allegedly kept locked in a room by her mother and grandparents for more than seven years. The girl reportedly showed no signs of abuse or malnourishment. However, she was "barely able to climb stairs on her own or navigate uneven ground".

370.title: 10-time MLA Mohansinh Rathava quits Congress ahead of Gujarat Assembly polls
370.article_body: Mohansinh Rathava, a 10-time Congress MLA from Gujarat's Chhota Udaipur, has quit the party ahead of Gujarat Assembly elections. Rathava was reportedly upset over Congress' inaction regarding the elections and is likely to join BJP. He had earlier said that he will not be contesting the upcoming elections as "the youth should get chance to represent" Chhota Udaipur.

371.title: 'Kantara' is also my film: Yash after host mistakenly says it's his film
371.article_body: During an event, Yash was asked about the success of the Kannada film 'Kantara'. While asking the question, the host said, "As we speak, Kantara, your new film...not your film but a Kannada film is making waves." Reacting to this, Yash said, "Sir, 'Kantara' is also my film. You said it's not my film but it is my film also."

372.title: Ishaan says Mira Rajput is the 'most complaining' member of the family
372.article_body: Ishaan Khatter, on being asked about the most complaining member of his family, named Mira Rajput Kapoor, the wife of Shahid Kapoor. "She complains to me all the time. She's like 'you haven't picked up your shoes...you have come 10 minutes late or something', so in that way, in a cute way. Not in any other way," Ishaan added.

373.title: India's first-ever private rocket built by Hyderabad startup to launch next week
373.article_body: India's first privately-built rocket Vikram-S, made by Hyderabad-based space-tech startup Skyroot Aerospace, will be launched between November 12 and November 16, the company announced. The launch window has been notified by authorities and the final date will be decided based on weather conditions, Skyroot CEO Pawan Chandana said. The launch will take place from ISRO's launchpad at Sriharikota.

374.title: Sloth bear tranquillised after attacking 3 men in TN dies after release
374.article_body: A 10-year-old female sloth bear, that was tranquillised by Tamil Nadu Forest Department officials in the foothills of the Western Ghats in Tenkasi district after it attacked three men, died a day after it was released in the wild. According to the officials, the bear died due to a lung infection. The injured villagers are undergoing treatment, Tenkasi Collector said.

375.title: Why is today's lunar eclipse called a Beaver Blood Moon eclipse?
375.article_body: Tuesday's total lunar eclipse got its name from Algonquian languages once spoken by Native Americans in the New England territory. It coincided with what they called the 'Beaver Moon' – a moniker for the November full Moon. As Earth casts shadow completely on the Moon, it dims the Moon's colour, giving it a reddish hue, hence the term "Blood Moon".

376.title: Masai School raises $10 mn, Mithali Raj & Bhaichung Bhutia join as investors
376.article_body: Masai School, a Bengaluru-based jobtech startup, has secured $10 million in Series B funding led by Omidyar Network India. The round also saw participation from former India women's cricket captain Mithali Raj and ex-Indian men's football team captain Bhaichung Bhutia, as investors and partners. The funding will enable Masai to launch two new course categories, 'MasaiX.' and 'Scholar Program'.

377.title: Offender arrested in Hyd for sale of fake educational certificates
377.article_body: A habitual offender was arrested in Hyderabad on Tuesday for indulging in the sale of fake educational certificates. Muqtar Ahmed, who used to con people on various pretexts, was taken into custody under the Preventive Detention Act. He and his associates, Kaleemuddin and Mohammed Feroze, used to create fake certificates and sell them to customers for large amounts of money.

378.title: Nigerian arrested with banned drugs worth ₹10 lakh in Navi Mumbai
378.article_body: A 42-year-old Nigerian national was arrested in Navi Mumbai for allegedly possessing banned drugs worth ₹10.3 lakh. The arrest happened after the  Anti-Narcotics Cell (ANC) of the Navi Mumbai Police raided premises in Vashi last weekend and seized 130 gm of Methaqualone from the Nigerian man, officials said. A case was registered under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act.

379.title: Hyd's NIMS to hold interim selection for MHM course on November 17
379.article_body: The Nizam's Institute of Medical Sciences (NIMS) in Hyderabad will hold a provisional selection of candidates for Masters in Hospital Management (MHM) course on November 17. Dean Dr N Bheerappa said the selection procedure is scheduled from 10 am onwards at the NIMS campus. Candidates whose names appear on the merit list should report with their certificates and hall ticket.

380.title: People I grew up with were cheering police: Guj man on being flogged
380.article_body: One of the Muslim men, who were tied to a pole and flogged allegedly by police personnel in Gujarat's Kheda last month, said, "People I grew up with watched and seemed to enjoy it as if it was entertainment." "They were cheering, laughing and chanting Jai Shri Ram while the policemen were humiliating us," the 48-year-old victim added.

381.title: Delhi students protest as funds not released for scholarship scheme
381.article_body: Beneficiaries under the Delhi government's coaching centre scholarship scheme protested outside the Department of SC/ST Welfare over non-payment of dues. The Jai Bhim Mukhyamantri Pratibha Vikas Yojana aims to train students from ST, SC, OBC and EWS categories for competitive exams. As funding for the scheme was not released, students said their monthly stipend of ₹2,500 was also withheld.

382.title: Dentist charged for throwing 4-yr-old daughter off B'luru building
382.article_body: Bengaluru Police filed a 193-page charge sheet against a dentist for allegedly throwing his four-year-old daughter off a building in August this year. According to reports, the accused was allegedly unhappy because of the medical condition of her daughter, due to which she had to sacrifice her professional life. She also tried leaving her daughter on an Orissa-bound train.

383.title: Delhi Capitals to release Shardul Thakur, four others ahead of IPL 2023: Reports
383.article_body: Delhi Capitals will release five players ahead of player retention deadline on November 15, PTI reported. The players include bowling all-rounder Shardul Thakur, wicketkeeper-batters KS Bharat and Tim Seifert, and batters Mandeep Singh and Ashwin Hebbar, PTI added. Thakur, who was bought by DC for ₹10.75 crore, took 15 wickets in IPL 2022 and had an economy rate of 9.79.

384.title: Who is Eugen Rochko, the coder who built Twitter rival Mastodon?
384.article_body: Eugen Rochko, the 29-year-old coder behind Twitter rival Mastodon, moved to Germany from Russia with his family when he was 11. He did B.Sc in computer science from a public university in Germany and launched Mastodon in 2016 when he was still studying. "The idea behind Mastodon is that online communication shouldn't be beholden to one private company," he says.

385.title: India is a very talented team, they will win T20 World Cup: ABD
385.article_body: Ex-South African skipper AB de Villiers said that India is a very talented team and they will win the ongoing T20 World Cup in Australia. "Everyone is playing well. Suryakumar Yadav and Virat Kohli are in great form. Rohit Sharma hasn't had his best of runs, but he will come into the party when it matters the most," he said.

386.title: Our bowlers have been outstanding throughout T20 WC: Williamson
386.article_body: New Zealand skipper Kane Williamson said their bowlers have been outstanding throughout the T20 World Cup 2022. Ahead of the semifinal match against Pakistan, Williamson said that they will have to adjust to the given conditions. "[In] the first game...here (SCG), the wicket was a very good one...Then the second time we played here it had changed," he added.

387.title: He absolutely murdered me before I got him out: Moeen Ali on Suryakumar's T20I hundred
387.article_body: Recalling Suryakumar Yadav's 117(55) against England, all-rounder Moeen Ali said, "He absolutely murdered me before I got him out." "He played amazingly well, some of the shots he played were some of the best I have ever seen," Ali added. "Thankfully, he was tired when I got him out...that's how I got him, I think," he stated.

388.title: Ex-serviceman kidnapped from Delhi, family gets 'sar tan se juda' threat
388.article_body: An ex-serviceman was kidnapped from Delhi's Sultanpuri area on Monday. After the victim, Rajendra Prasad, didn't return from work on Monday, his family tried calling him but the calls were disconnected several times. Prasad's family later received a message with a logo of Popular Front of India saying, "Sar tan se juda (head will be severed) in Ajmer via Pakistan."

389.title: It will happen soon: Arbaaz on film with brothers Salman and Sohail
389.article_body: Arbaaz Khan, when asked if he is planning to collaborate with brothers Salman Khan and Sohail Khan on a film, said, "There's a big possibility of that." "Right now, we're all engaged in our own things. But there will be a time when...[we'll] come together for something. And that might not be too late. It'll be quite soon," he added.

390.title: DU receives 1,000 applications for mid-entry window
390.article_body: The Delhi University (DU) has received over 1,000 applications in its mid-entry window to the varsity through the Common Seat Allocation System. Through the mid-entry window, candidates, who failed to apply before, get another chance to apply. The window was open from November 5 to 7. In total, DU offered around 70,000 undergraduate seats for admission this year.

391.title: AIMIM seeks permission to celebrate Tipu Jayanti at Idgah Maidan
391.article_body: All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) and some Dalit organisations have sought permission from the municipal corporation to celebrate Tipu Jayanti at the Idgah Maidan in Karnataka's Hubballi. Meanwhile, Sri Ram Sena has also submitted a memorandum seeking permission to celebrate Kanakadasa Jayanti there. Earlier, the state high court allowed Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations at the ground.

392.title: Stray dog gets stuck on middle of B'luru Metro track, rescued
392.article_body: A stray dog, which was stuck on a Bengaluru Metro track, was immediately rescued by an animal rescue team. The electricity on the track was turned off immediately and the engineering team of Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) was alerted soon after a Twitter user complained of the dog being stuck.

393.title: US aid worker shot dead in Baghdad: Iraqi officials
393.article_body: A US aid worker living in Baghdad was purportedly shot dead in the Iraqi capital on Monday, as per two police officials. The man was driving with his wife and child when a car cut him off and assailants in another car opened fire on him, the officials said. The motive behind the killing was not immediately clear, they added.

394.title: US hopes India will benefit from Russian oil price cap: US Treasury Secy
394.article_body: India will "benefit" from the proposed price cap on Russian oil, US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said ahead of her visit to India this week. "Our hope would be that India would take advantage of this price cap, though its firms are bargaining with Russia," Yellen said. "We want to make sure...Russia doesn't profit unduly from the war," Yellen added.

395.title: DeFi startup Flint moves out funds from crypto exchange FTX
395.article_body: Sequoia-backed decentralised finance startup Flint has "moved out" its funds from cryptocurrency exchange FTX. Bengaluru-based Flint told its users, "Given the situation with FTX...we want to ensure that your fund is safe and in order to do that, we have moved out all our funds from FTX safely." Flint allows users to earn up to 13% annually on deposited funds.

396.title: 62-year-old woman dies after falling into open manhole in Virar
396.article_body: A 62-year-old woman died after she accidentally fell into an open manhole in Virar, Maharashtra on Monday. The deceased, Kamlaben Shah, left her house to go to a local temple but didn't return and her body was found in the evening. A teenager informed of seeing a hand coming out of the water of the manhole, Kamlaben's husband Gulabchand said.

397.title: Ready to be hanged if my allegations are proved wrong: Conman Sukesh to Kejriwal
397.article_body: After alleging he gave money to AAP chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal in exchange for a Rajya Sabha seat, conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar made new allegations. He said AAP's Satyendar Jain asked for money for the party during Punjab and Goa polls. "Kejriwal Ji, if any of my raised issues...turn out to be wrong...I'm ready to be hanged," he added.

398.title: Zoho crosses $1 bn in revenue, to double investments in AI
398.article_body: Chennai-based software-as-a-service (SaaS) firm Zoho announced that it has crossed $1 billion in revenue with India leading the growth and the regional annual revenue increasing by 77% in 2021. "No one has built a billion-dollar product company in India," CEO and Co-Founder Sridhar Vembu said. Zoho also announced that it will double investment into technologies like blockchain and AI.

399.title: Armenia & Azerbaijan participate in US-mediated peace talks
399.article_body: The foreign ministers of Azerbaijan and Armenia have met in Washington to participate in US-mediated peace talks, a week after Russian President Vladimir Putin hosted a similar summit. US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said, "The United States is committed to the peace negotiations." Armenia and Azerbaijan have fought two wars (1991 and 2020) over the territory of Nagorno-Karabakh.

400.title: 7 arrested in China as residents resist COVID-19 restrictions
400.article_body: Seven people have been arrested in northeastern China after residents clashed with the police over enforcing strict COVID-19 restrictions. The arrests come as China records new COVID-19 cases daily, with Guangzhou city reporting 2,230 cases on Tuesday. China has maintained a "zero-COVID" policy, according to which quarantines, lockdowns and near-daily tests are compulsory.
